content.question: A representative from a company that manufactures items for left-handed people will attend a large convention. The representative hopes to find a left-handed person at the convention to try out the items. The representative will select an attendee at random until a left-handed person is found. Assume each selection is independent of another. If 10 percent of the convention attendees are left-handed, what is the probability that the representative must select 4 attendees to find one who is left-handed?
